results.title: The British isles: the land and the people
results.brief_description: Brief scenes of typical industrial, farming, and seafaring activities in the British Isles; the geographical and commercial influences of these activities; views of coastline, countryside, parks, towns, mines and factories.

results.title: The British avant-garde. 2. The Thirties: the official and unofficial avant-garde
results.brief_description: A compilation of British avant-garde and experimental documentary films from the thirties. The thirties in Britain was a period characterised by the slump, hunger marches and the rise of Fascism in Europe. These shifts led to a social idealism that is reflected in the ongoing flourishing of the avant-garde filmmaking that began in the twenties, and the founding of British realism under the auspices of the Empire Marketing Board and the GPO Film Unit. The diversity of filmmaking that characterises this era can be clearly seen in this compilation where different styles and genres jostle each other as do quite distinct voices, attitudes and political ideologies.
results.title_for_label: The British avant-garde. 2. The Thirties: the official and unofficial avant-garde

results.title: The British avant-garde. 1. The Twenties: Close up and The Film Society
results.brief_description: A compilation of rare British avant-garde and experimental films from the twenties. The loose group of filmmakers represented here contributed not only films, many of which are now lost or neglected, but also, by establishing the influential Film Society in 1925 and the equally influential film magazine ‘Close Up’ a few years later, provided a cultural framework for a complex web of film practices ranging from avant-garde experiments to agit-prop.
results.title_for_label: The British avant-garde. 1. The Twenties: Close up and The Film Society

results.title: The Bright land
results.creator_credit: Morten Parker, Guy Glover and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This tour of the islands in the West Indies Federation looks at the various resources of the islands, including sugar, coffee, bananas, oil, and bauxite. Good contrast between the beauty of the landscape and life on the land, with the moderninity of city life.

results.title: The Bridge
results.creator_credit: Jo Kennedy and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Danny Craven lives in Launching Place, a quiet town that is relatively isolated from the rest of the community. One day when Danny is buying groceries for her dysfunctional family, she watches the cars go by on the highway, wishing that one of them can transport her away. She meets Gary, a young man to whom she is instantly attracted and in one night discovers love and horror under the bridge.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jo Kennedy and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television

results.title: The Breath of life
results.creator_credit: Bewick Hack, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Visatone (Australia)
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of mouth to mouth or mouth to nose resuscitation in cases of apparent drowning, suffocation and electric shock. Shows how these conditions may occur, and demonstrates resuscitation technique.

results.title: The Brass choir: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: A fine and artfully “composed” documentary film of the orchestra in performance. Shows a sensitive demonstration of the tone color of instruments from the orchestra’s brass section with excerpts from Beethoven’s 5th Symphony, the Nocturne from Mendelson’s Midsummer Night’s Dream, Wagner’s Tannhauser.

results.title: The Brain Puzzle (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The ability of the brain to physically alter in response to external events accounts for the partial recovery of stroke and head injury victims. This program looks at the possibility for the brain to speed up these recovery processes.
results.description: The ability of the brain to physically alter in response to external events accounts for the partial recovery of stroke and head injury victims. This program looks at the possibility for the brain to speed up these recovery processes.
